sentences.sContent: His friends live above the bookshop.
sentences.sCn: 他的朋友们住在书店的楼上。

sentences.sContent: If you can't do anything on that scale (travel far and wide, or go back to college), you may chose to go to an interesting lecture at a bookshop and come away quite stimulated by what you hear.
sentences.sContent_eng: If you can't do anything on that scale (travel far and wide, or go back to college), you may chose to go to an interesting lecture at a bookshop and come away quite stimulated by what you hear.
sentences.sCn: 如果你在这一时期什么也不能做（比如旅行，郊游，读书等），那么你可以选择参加书店里有趣的演讲，你将会听到非常刺激的东西。

sentences.sContent: In Washington, DC, a normally sophisticated bookshop declares itself “your first stop” for the wedding.
sentences.sContent_eng: In Washington, DC, a normally sophisticated bookshop declares itself “your first stop” for the wedding.
sentences.sCn: 在华盛顿，一家久经世故的书店断言自己本身是婚礼的“第一站”。
